itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Tuesday, September 10, 2013
contentencoded: American companies that earned money overseas are looking for ways to spend it so they can avoid paying American taxes. This could be one of the reasons behind Microsoft's recent purchase of much of Nokia of Finland for more than $7 billion. Allan Sloan, senior editor-at-large for Fortune magazine, joins Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio to discuss.
description: Taxes may help explain Microsoft's recent purchase of much of Nokia.
title: The role taxes played in Microsoft's purchase of Nokia
